conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height/thickness, rooms read as volumes, and an angled/isometric-like viewpoint with roof/ceiling removed exposes interiors.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusion and thickness; distinct floor plane; good corner geometry; clean cutaway with readable interiors. Minor simplifications in openings/edge detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment footprint and main zones (left bedroom, central bath cluster, right bedroom, dining/kitchen, living area) are largely consistent. Some proportion/partition differences (notably the left bedroom and central corridor/partitioning) and reduced fidelity in wall lengths and door placements compared with the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (living sofa, dining set, kitchen counters, beds, desk). Bathroom fixtures simplified. Left bedroom appears to have only one bed vs two in the 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are distinguishable; lighting supports visibility; materials are consistent and background is clean. Minor ambiguity from simplified door/window modeling.

detected_errors.description: Left bedroom furniture does not match 2D plan: 2D shows two single beds; 3D shows only one bed.
Some internal wall proportions/partition alignment differ from the 2D plan, especially around the left bedroom and central circulation/partitioning.
Door/opening placements and representations are simplified; some doors appear missing or not on the exact walls indicated in 2D.

summary: A valid isometric cutaway 3D conversion with strong 3D fundamentals, but moderate layout/furniture mismatches reduce fidelity to the original 2D plan.
